entry.title: Wi-Fi Calling - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
Does Boost support Wi-Fi Calling?

Wi-Fi calling enables you to make calls using a fixed Wi-Fi connection from your compatible Boost phone when you can’t connect to the mobile network. Your phone simply uses your Wi-Fi network instead of the mobile network, so you can make and receive calls as you would normally.

 

To use Wi-Fi calling, you need to:

  • Have a Wi-Fi calling compatible smartphone or tablet
  • Have 4G voice calls enabled
  • Have up-to-date software
  • Turn on Wi-Fi calling

 

How do I turn on Wi-Fi calling?

For iPhone:

  1. Go to Settings
  2. Select Mobile
  3. Turn on Wi-Fi calling

 

For Android devices:

  1. Go to your phone's calling app
  2. Select More or the three dots in the top right corner
  3. Select Settings
  4. Turn on Wi-Fi Calling

entry.title: Included Calls - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
What types of calls are included in Boost plans?

All our plans include unlimited calls and text to standard national numbers, which means you can call regular landline and mobile numbers as much as you like. This also includes most 1800, 1300 or 13 numbers.

It excludes calls and texts to international numbers, satellite and premium numbers (eg. 19xx numbers), operator assisted calls (most 12xx numbers) and all use overseas.

Some of our plans also include standard calls to international numbers.

For more information about our current plan inclusions, click here.

entry.title: Recharge History - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
How do I see my recharge history?

 You can see your recharge history in the My Boost Mobile app.


Simply open the My Boost Mobile app and sign in with your username and password. Once logged in, tap on your phone number and scroll to the bottom of your balance summary screen. There you will see "Recharge History" - tap this and you'll be able to see your recharge history including when you recharged, how much you recharged, and your payment method. 

Where available you'll also be able to download a Receipt and Tax Invoice.

If you need more information, please message us by clicking the 'Message Us' button on our Help page.

entry.title: SIM Card Error - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
How can I fix my SIM card error?

There are a number of reasons that you are experiencing a SIM card error.

If your SIM is not installed properly, try turning off the phone, taking the sim out and putting it back in (make sure it it seated correctly) before restarting your phone. 

If this doesn't work, your SIM may be damaged or faulty and you'll likely need to order a replacement SIM.

Please contact us to further troubleshoot your error or order a replacement SIM. You can either give us a call on 125 88881 ( 8am-8pm AEST 7 days) or Message us here.

entry.title: Check for service disruptions - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
How to check for outages or service disruptions

If you are unable to use your Boost Mobile to send SMS, make calls or get online, it may be due to a disruption to Boost Mobile services. These issues can range from hardware faults to outages or scheduled maintenance on the Telstra Mobile Network infrastructure.

Click here to check if there is an outage or service disruption in your area. 

On this page you'll find updates on issues affecting our services across the country and where possible, provide an estimate restoration time so you know how long it will be until services are back up and running. 

If there are no known issues in your area, please contact us. The easiest way to get in touch is to Message us from our Help page.

entry.title: Need a Little Extra Data on Your Boost Mobile Plan?
entry.content:
Need a little Extra data?

Extras are perfect for those times that you need just a bit more on top of your current recharge. You can grab one using your favourite recharge method.

The current Boost Mobile Prepaid Plan has two Extra’s available:

  • $5 Data Pack – includes 1GB with a 7 day expiry
  • $20 Data Pack – includes 4GB with a 28 day expiry.

If you’re on Boost Anytime Ultra or Boost Anytime Plus (joined Boost between 31 October 2017 and 1 February 2021 and have not been updated to Boost Mobile Prepaid), there are two Add-Ons available.

  • $5 Add-On – includes 1B of data and $5 credit that can be used towards data (at standard rates), calls & text to satellite and premium numbers (e.g. 19xx numbers), operator assisted calls (most 12xx numbers)
  • $15 Add-On – includes 3GB of data and $15 credit that can be used towards data (at standard rates), calls & text to satellite and premium numbers (e.g. 19xx numbers), operator assisted calls (most 12xx numbers) and international calls and text from Australia not included in your recharge.

If you’re on UNLTD Plus (joined Boost between 12 July 2016 – 31 October 2017 and have not been updated to Boost Mobile Prepaid) you can grab a $15 Bolt-On.

If you’re on UNLTD (joined before 12 July 2016 and have not changed your offer) you can grab a $10 Add-On. Both include credit to use on international calls/text, data and premium services.

entry.title: Boost Mobile Data: What Gets Used First
entry.content:
Which data gets used first, bonus data or regular data?

Your bonus data is used first, followed by your regular recharge data and then any rollover data.

entry.title: How to Setup Boost Auto Recharge
entry.content:
How do I set up Auto recharge?

With auto recharge your phone will automatically recharge on expiry so you don't need to worry about recharging.

How to set up auto recharge using My Boost Mobile App:

Take the hassle out of recharging - follow these simple steps:

Payments Tab:

To set up Auto Recharge:
1. Sign in to the My Boost App with your Username and Password
2. Go to the Payments tab and ‘Auto recharge’ under the Recharge section
3. Select the auto recharge amount and confirm

Services Tab:
1. Sign in to the My Boost App with your Username and Password
2. Go to the Services tab and select your Boost Pre-Paid service
3. Scroll down to ‘More with your Mobile’ section and select Auto Recharge
4. Select the auto recharge amount and confirm

How to set up auto recharge using My Boost Mobile Online

1. Go to the website
2. Enter your Username and password and click the black "sign in" button.
3. Confirm your identity through the two-step verification. Select where you'd like us to send your one-time code. e.g. email or phone number. Then tap the black "Next" button.
4. Enter the 6 digit code then click the "Next" button.
5. Go to "Services" tab and the choose "Manage Pre-paid".
6. Scroll down to More with your mobile section and select "Auto recharge:Off"
7. Select your auto recharge amount and follow the prompts

If you're on one of our older plans (e.g. Anytime Ultra or Anytime Plus), you will be able to set up auto recharge in a couple of months, once you’ve been moved onto our new plans and are eligible to use the new My Boost Mobile app. We will notify you when this has taken place. 

Still got questions on Auto Recharge? Check out our full Auto Recharge FAQs.

entry.title: Boost Balance & Usage Check
entry.content:
How do I check my balance and usage?

You can check your balance and usage using the My Boost Mobile app, online or your phone. 

To check your balance and usage using the My Boost Mobile app

  1. Open the app 
  2. Tap on your Prepaid Service - your current balance will be displayed
  3. Tap data breakdown to see your bonus data / rollover data details

The My Boost Mobile app is available on Android and iPhone. 

 

    To check your balance using My Boost Mobile online

    1. Go online 
    2. Sign in with your username and password and confirm your identity using the two factor authorization code.
    3. Your current data is displayed in the account overview.
    4. Go to services tab and select Manage Pre-Paid to view full breakdown of your data usage including bonus / rollover data will be displayed.
